result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua James Spice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua James Spice in court with attorney Paul J. Manley.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
The defendant contacted the clerk and and advised the clerk that he was just released from custody.  The clerk advised the defendant of the next scheduled court date.

Defendant Joshua James Spice not in court, defendant in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney Manley was in court earlier but did not know the defendant was in custody.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 08-03-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua James Spice
Current: 3539 East Plankington Avenue #6, Cudahy, WI 53110   (Effective: 06-23-2015)
Prior: 3539 East Plankington Avenue #6, Cudahy, WI 53110
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Aaron M. or his residence or place of employment

Defendant Joshua James Spice in court.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.24  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 06-23-2015 at 01:30pm
